TreEvo
  • Reference

Hacked version of Geiger's fitContinuous

This is TreEvo's version of fitContinuous. This version differs from Geigers in using a different optimization routine, lack of bounds, use of pseudoinverse for matrix inversion, and multiple start values.

fitContinuous.hacked(phy, data, data.names = NULL, model = c("BM", "OU",
  "lambda", "kappa", "delta", "EB", "white", "trend"), bounds = NULL,
  meserr = NULL, userstart = NULL, badLnL = 10000)

Arguments

phy

Phylogenetic tree in phylo format
data

data matrix with rownames equal to phy
data.names

Tip names that match phy
model

Choice of models include "BM", "OU", "lambda", "kappa", "delta", "EB", "white", "trend"
bounds

NULL for fitContinuous.hacked
meserr

Measurement error, if any
userstart

Optional user start input
badLnL

Return value for bad likelihood calculations

Value

Returns a matrix of parameter estimates, along with approximate standard errors and 95 log-likelihood of the model (lnl).

Details

See Geiger's fitContinuous for details.

References

O'Meara and Banbury, unpublished; Harmon et al. 2007

Examples



data(simData)
fitContinuous.hacked(simPhy, simChar, model="lambda")
#> $Trait1
#> $Trait1$lnl
#> [1] -5.385279
#> 
#> $Trait1$beta
#> [1] 0.6922748
#> 
#> $Trait1$lambda
#> [1] 1.002285
#> 
#> $Trait1$aic
#> [1] 16.77056
#> 
#> $Trait1$aicc
#> [1] 17.73056
#> 
#> $Trait1$k
#> [1] 3
#> 
#>
